channel.title: PS3 Video Download Service (launching today)
channel.description:
[quote="PSU"]Sony revealed more details on its anticipated video download service at its E3 press conference, including that it'll go live tonight.
The slick interface, which willll be familiar to PlayStation Store users, will let you browse through content from partners including Fox, MGM, Disney, Lionsgate, Warner, Paramount and Turner. You'll be able to preview content in the form of a video before you commit to purchasing anything, as well as read the standard blurb and technical details.
TV shows will be available in standard and high definition, with prices starting at $1.99. For movies, rental and purchase prices will start at $2.99 and $9.99 respectively.
We'll let you see the selection of movies for yourselves when the service launches later today![/quote]
This could be something really special. I'm definitely getting my dads credit details ready for this :) High definition movies rentals at a touch of a button YES!

item.title: PS3 Video Download Service (launching today)
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Interesting article at http://www.popularmechanics.com/technology/reviews/4273757.html about Sony’s E3 conference.

popularmechanics.com:

Bottom Line: Another rare example of much deserved hype. Forget Metal Gear Solid 4 and the Resistance franchise—if there’s a reason to buy a PlayStation 3, this [littleBigPlanet] is it.

item.title: PS3 Video Download Service (launching today)
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:11, topic:220715”]It won’t be a game, it’ll be more like the core of playstation network with all the game intergration, the video service (That will tie in into a cinema in the game etc), the trophy rooms, the live events space ('sif it’ll ever get used by sony though rifk), the clothes shops, your own apartment (which i can’t wait to waste a tonne of money on getting all the best stuff :P), the ability to launch an online game with friends and all join that same game together, then quit and end up back into home.

I just keep thinking people expect it to be something you can play for hours, when its really not. It’ll bring the community that, in my opinion is missing from psn.[/quote]
Also it allows fat kids to socialise with strangers without getting up

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 Video Download Service (launching today)
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

We have something to look forward too though (Excluding littlebigplanet :D)
http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/sony-confirms-80gb-ps3-for-europe (Ignore the title)

SCEE boss David Reeves has revealed that the 80GB PlayStation 3 SKU, which was confirmed for North America in the E3 Sony press conference on Tuesday, will arrive into Europe on August 27, although the video download service will not make it across the Atlantic.

Speaking at an informal reception for EMEA media in the Viceroy Hotel, Santa Monica, Reeves also gave pricing and release details for the forthcoming Platinum range of PS3 titles.

“Generally, everything that Jack Tretton laid out [in the Sony press conference], with only two exceptions, pertains exactly to the PAL markets,” he said. "This is symptomatic of the fact that our company is getting more global, and more consistent - the exceptions are the video download service and some of the specifics of the PSP and PS2 promotions.

"PS3 80GB - we will introduce this in the PAL markets on August 27, it will be a simultaneous release. It will come in at EUR 399, GBP 299, and we will be doing promotional bundles from the middle of September to the end of December at various prices…the 80GB replaces the 40GB.

“We will launch Platinum for PS3 on August 1, so that’s the same time frame as North America. The suggested retail price will be EUR 29.99 and GBP 19.99.”

[size=16pt]He went on to clarify that PlayStation Home will also launch into open beta on the same day and date this Autumn as the US market, and that the precise date would be revealed nearer the time.[/size]

He also confirmed that while the video download service wouldn’t appear in Europe in 2008, announcements would be made later in the year, and that the corporation’s chairman, Sir Howard Stringer, had committed to providing the non-games services in all territories over time.

Read full topic

item.title: PS3 Video Download Service (launching today)
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

We don’t get it till autumn, it was out in america 5 hours ago. Even still its got over 300 films and tv shows already and 5 - 6 companys involved, for launch thats pretty impressive (Though, sony do produce alot of films). They say they’ll be adding new content weekly.

(Plus, it wont show you if you have an american account its actually based on your location now due to region locking sony don’t want you to go buy stuff you wont be able to use).

Read full topic
